summary: Some criminal groups use a process called trade-based money laundering to launder their illicit money. These schemes can include things like falsely describing goods and services in trade transactions. Banks are required to report suspicious financial transactions to the Treasury Department. However, we found that banks often do not have access to the documentation for most of the trade transactions for which they process payments...
title: Countering Illicit Finance and Trade: U.S. Efforts to Combat Trade-Based Money Laundering
